gurmukhi: Aibkwr BUp ijqy Bey ] kr rwj AMq smY gey ] kib kOn nwm iqnY gnY ] sMkyq kwih ieqy BnY ]107]
transliteration: Abikaar Bhoop Kite Bhae|| Kar Raaj Ant Samai Gad|| Kabi Kaoun Naam Tinai Gadai|| Sanket Kaah(i) Ite Bhanai||107||
translation: All the immaculate kings ultimately merged in the Lord after their rule, which poet can enumerate their names? Therefore, I have only hinted about them.107.

gurmukhi: ieiq byn rwjw miRq bs hoq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Ben Raajaa Mrit Bas Hot Bhae||
translation: End of the description about the king Ben and his death.
Now beings the description about the rule of Mandhata

gurmukhi: jyqk BUp Bey AvnI pr ] nwm skY iqn ky kiv ko Dir ] nwm jQwmiq BwK sunwaU ] ic`q qaU Apny fr pwaU ]108]
transliteration: Jetak Bhoop Bhae Avanidar|| Naam Sakai Tin Ke Kavi Ko Dhar(i)|| Naam Jathaamat(i) Bhaakh Sounaaoo|| Chitt Taoo Apne Dar Paaoo||108||
translation: All the kings who have ruled over the earth, which poet can describe their names? I fear the increase of this volume by narrating their names.108.

gurmukhi: byn gey jg qy niRpqw kir ] mwnXDwq Bey bsuDw Dir ] bwsv log gey jb hI vr ] auT dXo ArDwsn bwsv iqh ]109]
transliteration: Ben Gad Jag Te Nriptaa Kar(i)|| Maanyadhaat Bhae Basudhaa Dhar(i)|| Baasab Log Gad Jab Hibah|| Outh Dyoardhaasan Baasav Tih||109||
translation: After the rule of Ben, Mandhata became the king; when he went to the country of Indra, Indra gave him half his seat.109.

gurmukhi: ros BrXo qb mwn mhIDr ] hwNk ghXo kir K`g BXMkr ] mwrn lwg jbY irs ieMdiH ] bwh ghI qqkwl idijMdiH ]110]
transliteration: Ros Bdaryo Tab Maan Maheedhar|| Haank Gadyo Kar(i) Khagg Bhayankar||maaran Laag Jabai Ris Indrah(i)|| Baah Gaditatkaal Dijindrah(i)||110||
translation: The king Mandhata was filled with rage and challenging him, held his dagger in his hand; when, in his fury, he was about to strike Indra, then Brihaspati immediately caught his hand.110.

gurmukhi: nws kro ijn bwsv ko niRp ] Awsn ArD dXo quh Xw bRq ] hY lvnwsR mhwsur BUX pir ] qwih n mwr skY qum ikau kr ]111]
transliteration: Naas Daro Jeen Baasav Ko Nrip|| Aasan Aradh Dayo Tuh Yaa Brat|| Hai Lavnaasra Mahaasur Bhooya Par(i)|| Taah(i) Na Maar Sakai Toum Kio Kar||111||
translation: He said, “O king ! do not strike Indra; there is reason on his part for offering you half of his seat; there is one demon named Lavanasura on earth; why have you not been able to kill him as yet?111.

gurmukhi: jO qum qwih sMGwr kY Awvhu ] qO qum ieMdR isMGwsn pwvhu ] AYsy kY ArD isMGwsn bYThu ] swcu kho pr nwk n AYThu ]112]
transliteration: Jau Toum Taah(i) Sanhaar Kai Aavoh|| Tau Toum Indra Singhaasan Paavoh|| Aise Kai Ardh Singhaasan Baithoh|| Saach(u) Kaho Par Naak Na Aithoh||112||
translation: “When you will come after killing him, you will then have the full seat of Indra, therefore now be seated on half the seat and accepting this truth, do not exhibit your anger.”112.

gurmukhi: DwXo AsqR lY kY qhw ] mQrw mMfl dwno Qw jhw ] mhw grbu kY kY mhwmMd bu`DI ] mhw jor kY kY dlM prm kRu`DI ]113]
transliteration: Dhaayo Astra Lai Kai Tahaa|| Mathraa Mandal Daano Thaa Jahaa|| Mahaa Gadb(u) Kai Mahaamannd Buddhee|| Mahaa Jor Kai Kai Kalan Param Kruddhee||113||
translation: The king, taking up his weapons, reached there, where the demon lived in Mathura-Mandal; he was a great stupid and an egoist; he was a most powerful one and dreadfully outrageous.113.

gurmukhi: mhw Gor kY kY GnM kI Gtw jXo ] su DwieAw rxM ib`julI kI Ctw jXo ] suny srb dwno su swmuih isDwey ] mhw kRoD kY kY su bwjI ncwey ]114]
transliteration: Mahaa Ghor Kai Kai Ghanan Kighataa Jyo|| Su Dhaaiaa Ranan Bijjuliki Chhataa Jyo|| Soune Sarab Daano Su Saamuh(i) Sidhaae|| Mahaa Krodh Kai Kai Su Baajinachaae||114||
translation: Thundering like the clouds Mandhata fell upon (the demon) in the battlefield like lightning; when the demons heard this, they also confronted him and furioudly caused their horses to dance.114.
